questions.question: What one word best describes what AI can do?
Which of the following Narrow AI systems would you want to include when building the Broad AI system for a self-driving car?
options: Information from the global positioning system (GPS)
questions.correct_answer: Information from the global positioning system (GPS)

questions.question: Complete the sentence. _______________ performs tasks without human intervention and completes mundane and repetitive tasks for humans, while _______________ allows humans to make final decisions after analyzing data, reports, and other types of data.
Fill in the blank. ___________ systems are used to predict global weather, trace pandemics, and help businesses predict future trends?
Complete the sentence. Artificial intelligence (AI) refers to the ability of a machine to ________________ and ________________.
In which era did computers guide astronauts from Earth to the moon and advance to handle more than one kind of instruction?
In which era did the advancements in fields ranging from cancer research to energy production show how its achievements impact people every day, and that it has exponentially increasing abilities?
In which era did machines help humans sort data into structures to reveal its secrets, that is, to reveal more insight than just simply counting to get a sum total?
Which of the following is the correct order of the three eras of computing?
If names and email addresses are organized using a spreadsheet software, like Google Sheets or Microsoft Excel, which type of data is this?
Approximately how much of the world’s data today is unstructured?
Shelby writes a survey that includes the following question: 'Do you like chocolate (circle Yes or No), and why?' Which of the following describes the data Shelby will collect?
options: Neither structured data nor unstructured data
Both structured data and unstructured data
questions.correct_answer: Both structured data and unstructured data

questions.question: Which of the following is most likely to be unstructured data?
options: The breeds of entrants in a dog show
Prescriptions for patients in a large hospital

questions.question: Fill in the blank. Data that is not completely raw and contains elements such as tags and organizational metadata is known as _______________.
Which of the following is an example of a probabilistic calculation?
options: A strong feeling you are most likely correct

questions.question: Tomas is programming an app to help people find their way in his city. He programs every possible route from the university auditorium to the museum. Which of the following is Tomas likely using?
Why does machine learning find answers in unstructured data more quickly than a programmable computer?
options: Machine learning assembles all the data into a table before calculating.
Machine learning can search every combination of factors very quickly.
Machine learning analyzes every data combination.
Machine learning uses the most sophisticated program code.
questions.correct_answer: Machine learning can search every combination of factors very quickly.

questions.question: Fill in the blank. Machine learning can analyze _______________ data more quickly than a programmable computer can.
Complete the sentence. Machine learning is a type of AI with many advantages over programmable computers, including the distinguishing capability to _______________ and _______________.
Which method of learning does an AI system use when it uses the process of trial and error?
You train Google Photos to identify people in photographs. As a result, Google Photos can recognize their faces. What kind of learning is this?
YouTube and Netflix often recommend options to users. What kind of learning is used to generate these recommendations?
Fill in the blank. All supervised learning algorithms need __________ data.
Fill in the blank. __________ learning occurs when the algorithm is given unlabeled data.
What do AI researchers call the type of systems likely to emerge by 2050 and beyond?
What type of AI do services, such as Netflix, use to recommend offerings to users?
Tesla cars are all connected and share what they learn when autonomously driving. This is an example of which of the following levels of AI?
Which of the following represents the idea that AI will move into all industries, from finance, to education, to healthcare, increasing productivity and enabling new opportunities?
With the use of billions of sensors, what is the new idea that will help to improve the Earth’s safety, sustainability, and security?
Which of the following acts on behalf of people in the physical world in a way that complements human abilities?
Which of the following is the level of AI that is more versatile, can handle a wider range of related tasks, and is focused on integrating AI within specific business processes?
Which of the following is a key attribute of an artificial intelligence system?
Which of the following methods of learning describes how an AI system learns using trial and error?
Which of the following explains why an AI trained with machine learning can rapidly map the best route between two points on a map?
options: It performs millions of tiny calculations quickly, trying different routes through trial and error.
It relies on a complete database of all possible routes through the city.
It predicts traffic problems based on stored alternative routes for every possible situation.
It uses predefined programming instructions to navigate through traffic.
questions.correct_answer: It performs millions of tiny calculations quickly, trying different routes through trial and error.

questions.question: In which of the following eras of computing did an IBM system beat a chess champion, a robot drive itself down a 131-mile desert trail, and IBM Watson beat two Jeopardy! grand champions?
How does machine learning enable decision-making in complex scenarios, such as medical treatment choices?
options: By ignoring potential outcomes and personal experience in decision making
By offering deterministic solutions based on fixed criteria
By relying solely on AI systems to make treatment decisions without human input
By providing probabilistic statements with confidence levels for different treatment options
questions.correct_answer: By providing probabilistic statements with confidence levels for different treatment options

questions.question: Which of the following describes how machine learning differs from classical systems in structuring unstructured data?
options: Machine learning offers probabilistic statements instead of binary decisions.
Machine learning relies on deterministic algorithms to process unstructured data.
Machine learning constructs a predetermined structure of routes based on a database.
Machine learning relies on human judgment to structure unstructured data.
questions.correct_answer: Machine learning offers probabilistic statements instead of binary decisions.

questions.question: Which of the following is a likely consequence of AI becoming more pervasive across industries?
options: Enhanced productivity and the creation of new opportunities
Reliance on current machine interface technologies will be strengthened
Humans and machine interactions will become increasingly standardized
questions.correct_answer: Enhanced productivity and the creation of new opportunities

questions.question: Which of the following types of data can be analyzed more quickly by machine learning than by a programmable computer?
Which level of AI refers to machines that can perform any intellectual task that a human can?
Which of the following is an example of structured data?
Which of the following types of data is categorized as qualitative data, and cannot be processed and analyzed by conventional data tools and methods?
Which of the following statements most accurately describes semi-structured data?
options: Data that lacks any built-in organization or structure, such as images and texts
Information that can be organized in rows and columns, like in a spreadsheet
Data that combines features of both structured and unstructured data, using metadata for organization
Quantitative data processed and analyzed by conventional data tools
questions.correct_answer: Data that combines features of both structured and unstructured data, using metadata for organization

questions.question: Which of the following is the best reason to support moving to an AI system for analyzing social media data?
options: Social media data contains a mix of structured and unstructured data.
Social media data is completely structured.
Social media data is completely unstructured.
questions.correct_answer: Social media data contains a mix of structured and unstructured data.

questions.question: Which of the following is a primary application of LLMs?
options: Generating text based on given prompts
questions.correct_answer: Generating text based on given prompts

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a large language model (LLM)?
options: It is a type of machine learning model that processes and generates human-like text.
It is a database system optimized for handling large volumes of text data.
It is a specialized networking model that processes data from different sources.
It is a software tool used primarily for data encryption.
questions.correct_answer: It is a type of machine learning model that processes and generates human-like text.

questions.question: What makes transformers special in handling text?
options: They can pay attention to all parts of the sentence at once.
They can read and write text simultaneously.
They work better with numbers than with words.
They focus only on the most recent word in a sentence.
questions.correct_answer: They can pay attention to all parts of the sentence at once.

questions.question: Which technologies have advanced the operation of LLMs?
options: Machine learning and artificial neural networks
questions.correct_answer: Machine learning and artificial neural networks

questions.question: Why is a large amount of data important for training large language models (LLMs)?
options: It decreases the model's reliance on internet connectivity.
Large datasets reduce the model's speed, making it more thorough in processing text.
It helps the model to improve its accuracy by learning from a wide variety of text examples.
Large data sets are required to meet regulatory compliance for data storage.
questions.correct_answer: It helps the model to improve its accuracy by learning from a wide variety of text examples.
